* Standalone publisher example


Is there a better way to submit multiple features? Is it possible to separate the default branch into two feature branches and submit them separately? Or is it ok to just keep piling up changes in this pull request?

Is there a better way to submit multiple features? Is it possible to separate the default branch into two feature branches and submit them separately? Or is it ok to just keep piling up changes in this pull request?

  • Standalone publisher example

Is there a better way to submit multiple features? Is it possible to separate the default branch into two feature branches and submit them separately? Or is it ok to just keep piling up changes in this pull request?

values.description: I was trying to compile on my mac, and I had a source build of the latest boost and ran into a compile error with the threadpool dependency. Boost changed one of its internal symbols from TIME_UTC to TIME_UTC_ for Boost 1.50 and greater ([Boost ticket 6940](https://svn.boost.org/trac/boost/ticket/6940)).
values.title: Compatibility with Boost >= 1.50

summary.raw: I was trying to compile on my mac, and I had a source build of the latest boost and ran into a compile error with the threadpool dependency. Boost changed one of its internal symbols from TIME_UTC to TIME_UTC_ for Boost 1.50 and greater ([Boost ticket 6940](https://svn.boost.org/trac/boost/ticket/6940)).
summary.html: I was trying to compile on my mac, and I had a source build of the latest boost and ran into a compile error with the threadpool dependency. Boost changed one of its internal symbols from TIME_UTC to TIME_UTC_ for Boost 1.50 and greater (Boost ticket 6940).

values.description:
These fixes make gazebo compile on OSX and let it run gzclient. I could not get gzserver to run since it would endlessly wait for a master who apparently did not connect, so I ran the gzserver in a parallels Ubuntu. The gzclient then runs with 2 windows which you cannot give input to (i.e. no mouse events or keyboard events seem to be recorded, you cannot even click on the windows to get focus, only on their title bars).

ps. this is my first pull request ever so let me know if I am doing something wrong.
values.title: Compile and run fixes for OSX

summary.raw:
These fixes make gazebo compile on OSX and let it run gzclient. I could not get gzserver to run since it would endlessly wait for a master who apparently did not connect, so I ran the gzserver in a parallels Ubuntu. The gzclient then runs with 2 windows which you cannot give input to (i.e. no mouse events or keyboard events seem to be recorded, you cannot even click on the windows to get focus, only on their title bars).

ps. this is my first pull request ever so let me know if I am doing something wrong.
summary.html:
These fixes make gazebo compile on OSX and let it run gzclient. I could not get gzserver to run since it would endlessly wait for a master who apparently did not connect, so I ran the gzserver in a parallels Ubuntu. The gzclient then runs with 2 windows which you cannot give input to (i.e. no mouse events or keyboard events seem to be recorded, you cannot even click on the windows to get focus, only on their title bars).

ps. this is my first pull request ever so let me know if I am doing something wrong.

values.description:
A couple of little improvements in display capabilities detection:

* Check if DISPLAY environment is set but empty. Which should be consider as invalid.
* Check glxinfo for explicit string of: direct rendering support. Seems to work better to detect problems inside chroots.
values.title: Improve display capabilities detection

summary.raw:
A couple of little improvements in display capabilities detection:

* Check if DISPLAY environment is set but empty. Which should be consider as invalid.
* Check glxinfo for explicit string of: direct rendering support. Seems to work better to detect problems inside chroots.
summary.html:
A couple of little improvements in display capabilities detection:

  • Check if DISPLAY environment is set but empty. Which should be consider as invalid.
  • Check glxinfo for explicit string of: direct rendering support. Seems to work better to detect problems inside chroots.

values.description:
SDF 1.4 changes:

- Added bullet sdf descriptions and merged in simbody sdf descriptions
- Implemented a generic SetParam function in BulletPhysics and ODEPhysics
- Enabled setting of bullet physics params through msgs
- Deprecated Physics's dt and update_rate params and replaced them by max_step_size and real_time_update_rate
- Updated GUI (ModelListWidget) to reflect the changes to Physics 

Still need to be done:

- Support setting real time factor (sdf description added but functionality not yet implemented) Ticketed issue #576

Update: Fix gz_log test that was broken by sdf 1.4

Update: Moved max_step_size and real_time_update_rate from world.sdf to physics.sdf

Update: Updated joint sdf description, add joint unit test

Update: Remove deprecated flags in physics.proto to get rid of build warnings
values.title: SDF 1.4

summary.raw:
SDF 1.4 changes:

- Added bullet sdf descriptions and merged in simbody sdf descriptions
- Implemented a generic SetParam function in BulletPhysics and ODEPhysics
- Enabled setting of bullet physics params through msgs
- Deprecated Physics's dt and update_rate params and replaced them by max_step_size and real_time_update_rate
- Updated GUI (ModelListWidget) to reflect the changes to Physics 

Still need to be done:

- Support setting real time factor (sdf description added but functionality not yet implemented) Ticketed issue #576

Update: Fix gz_log test that was broken by sdf 1.4

Update: Moved max_step_size and real_time_update_rate from world.sdf to physics.sdf

Update: Updated joint sdf description, add joint unit test

Update: Remove deprecated flags in physics.proto to get rid of build warnings
summary.html:
SDF 1.4 changes:

  • Added bullet sdf descriptions and merged in simbody sdf descriptions
  • Implemented a generic SetParam function in BulletPhysics and ODEPhysics
  • Enabled setting of bullet physics params through msgs
  • Deprecated Physics's dt and update_rate params and replaced them by max_step_size and real_time_update_rate
  • Updated GUI (ModelListWidget) to reflect the changes to Physics

Still need to be done:

  • Support setting real time factor (sdf description added but functionality not yet implemented) Ticketed issue #576

Update: Fix gz_log test that was broken by sdf 1.4

Update: Moved max_step_size and real_time_update_rate from world.sdf to physics.sdf

Update: Updated joint sdf description, add joint unit test

Update: Remove deprecated flags in physics.proto to get rid of build warnings

values.description:
Publication to local subscribers now bypasses serialization.

Also added worker threads for the serialization process.

There is a new test in `test/regression/transport.cc' that publishes 1000 image messages which each has a size of 2048x2048. In default, this takes over 2 seconds. This pull request take 0.03 seconds.

**Update:** Merged from default and tested.
values.title: Improve publication performance

summary.raw:
Publication to local subscribers now bypasses serialization.

Also added worker threads for the serialization process.

There is a new test in `test/regression/transport.cc' that publishes 1000 image messages which each has a size of 2048x2048. In default, this takes over 2 seconds. This pull request take 0.03 seconds.

**Update:** Merged from default and tested.
summary.html:
Publication to local subscribers now bypasses serialization.

Also added worker threads for the serialization process.

There is a new test in `test/regression/transport.cc' that publishes 1000 image messages which each has a size of 2048x2048. In default, this takes over 2 seconds. This pull request take 0.03 seconds.

Update: Merged from default and tested.

values.description:
Fixes issue #581, implemented by applying the following scripts to the gazebo source directory:

~~~
for i in $(grep -rnI shared_dynamic_cast . | sed -e 's@:.*@@'); \
  do \
  sed -e 's@shared_dynamic_cast@dynamic_pointer_cast@g' $i > $i.tmp; \
  mv $i.tmp $i; \
done

for i in $(grep -rnI shared_static_cast . | sed -e 's@:.*@@'); \
  do \
  sed -e 's@shared_static_cast@dynamic_pointer_cast@g' $i > $i.tmp; \
  mv $i.tmp $i; \
done
~~~
values.title: Resolve issue #581: change shared_*_cast to *_pointer_cast for boost 1.53

summary.raw:
Fixes issue #581, implemented by applying the following scripts to the gazebo source directory:

~~~
for i in $(grep -rnI shared_dynamic_cast . | sed -e 's@:.*@@'); \
  do \
  sed -e 's@shared_dynamic_cast@dynamic_pointer_cast@g' $i > $i.tmp; \
  mv $i.tmp $i; \
done

for i in $(grep -rnI shared_static_cast . | sed -e 's@:.*@@'); \
  do \
  sed -e 's@shared_static_cast@dynamic_pointer_cast@g' $i > $i.tmp; \
  mv $i.tmp $i; \
done
~~~
summary.html:
Fixes issue #581, implemented by applying the following scripts to the gazebo source directory:

for i in $(grep -rnI shared_dynamic_cast . | sed -e 's@:.*@@'); \
  do \
  sed -e 's@shared_dynamic_cast@dynamic_pointer_cast@g' $i > $i.tmp; \
  mv $i.tmp $i; \
done

for i in $(grep -rnI shared_static_cast . | sed -e 's@:.*@@'); \
  do \
  sed -e 's@shared_static_cast@dynamic_pointer_cast@g' $i > $i.tmp; \
  mv $i.tmp $i; \
done

values.description:
With new cmake test generators is not needed to check VALID_DRI_DISPLAY or VALID_DISPLAY. Just use the cmake macros and it will do the magic for you.

I'm supposing here that Ray, Imu, and Sensor test need only display a SesnsorManager also need DRI.
values.title: Use proper test cmake macros when builing display or DRI tests

values.description:
Several tests (usually bandwidth) fail sporadically on Jenkins as documented in issue #579. I had trouble replicating this on my machine, until I removed all pr2 models from my GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH so that the bandwidth test would be forced to download the model from the model database. In testing on my machine, this can take between 24-40 seconds, which was causing a failure since the ServerFixture has a 30 second timeout for loading the Server.

I've increased the timeout to 60 seconds and added a console message so that we can see a history of how long it takes to load when it's successful (ie. if it often takes 55 or 59 seconds, then the 60 second timeout will likely be violated).

The console message looks like this:
~~~
Warning [ServerFixture.hh:136] ServerFixture load in 40.79 seconds, timeout after 60 seconds
~~~
values.title: Fix for #579, sporadic failures of bandwidth test

summary.raw:
Several tests (usually bandwidth) fail sporadically on Jenkins as documented in issue #579. I had trouble replicating this on my machine, until I removed all pr2 models from my GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH so that the bandwidth test would be forced to download the model from the model database. In testing on my machine, this can take between 24-40 seconds, which was causing a failure since the ServerFixture has a 30 second timeout for loading the Server.

I've increased the timeout to 60 seconds and added a console message so that we can see a history of how long it takes to load when it's successful (ie. if it often takes 55 or 59 seconds, then the 60 second timeout will likely be violated).

The console message looks like this:
~~~
Warning [ServerFixture.hh:136] ServerFixture load in 40.79 seconds, timeout after 60 seconds
~~~
summary.html:
Several tests (usually bandwidth) fail sporadically on Jenkins as documented in issue #579. I had trouble replicating this on my machine, until I removed all pr2 models from my GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH so that the bandwidth test would be forced to download the model from the model database. In testing on my machine, this can take between 24-40 seconds, which was causing a failure since the ServerFixture has a 30 second timeout for loading the Server.

I've increased the timeout to 60 seconds and added a console message so that we can see a history of how long it takes to load when it's successful (ie. if it often takes 55 or 59 seconds, then the 60 second timeout will likely be violated).

The console message looks like this:

Warning [ServerFixture.hh:136] ServerFixture load in 40.79 seconds, timeout after 60 seconds

values.description:
This is a fix for issue #589, related to specifying camera poses. The <camera><pose> element was being ignored by CameraSensor, and the pose math was wrong for the MultiCameraSensor. See the issue description page for more details.

This bug was found while creating camera sensors for the sandia hands, and should potentially be back-ported to gazebo 1.5.
values.title: Fix for issue #589: camera pose problems

summary.raw:
This is a fix for issue #589, related to specifying camera poses. The <camera><pose> element was being ignored by CameraSensor, and the pose math was wrong for the MultiCameraSensor. See the issue description page for more details.

This bug was found while creating camera sensors for the sandia hands, and should potentially be back-ported to gazebo 1.5.
summary.html:
This is a fix for issue #589, related to specifying camera poses. The <camera><pose> element was being ignored by CameraSensor, and the pose math was wrong for the MultiCameraSensor. See the issue description page for more details.

This bug was found while creating camera sensors for the sandia hands, and should potentially be back-ported to gazebo 1.5.

values.description:
Submeshes can be use as visuals and collisions using a new SDF tag:


```
#!xml

<geometry>
  <mesh>
    <uri>some_mesh_uri</uri>
    <submesh>
      <name>Name of the submesh</name>
      <center>true/false, where true = center vertices at 0,0,0</center>
    </submesh>
  </mesh>
</geometry>
```

This pull-request is an example: #!/osrf/gazebo_models/pull-request/25/polaris-raise-steering-wheel-add-collision/diff

**Update:** Added tests.
values.title: Allow submeshes to be used as visuals and collisions

PhysicsEngine_TEST.cc:67, GNU Compiler 4 (gcc), Priority: Normal

'type' may be used uninitialized in this function [-Wmaybe-uninitialized]

http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-default-devel-quantal-amd64/93/warnings13Result/?

values.description: Fixes issues #595
values.title: move time measurement to outside of lock to avoid assertion on sensor reinsertion

summary.raw: Fixes issues #595
summary.html: Fixes issues #595

values.description:
Add independent (uncorrelated) Gaussian noise to each beam in a ray sensor.  Example SDF, using values that are appropriate for a Hokuyo UTM-30LX:

          <noise>
            <type>gaussian</type>
            <mean>0.0</mean>
            <stddev>0.01</stddev>
          </noise>

Basic test included.
values.title: Add Gaussian noise model to ray sensors

summary.raw:
Add independent (uncorrelated) Gaussian noise to each beam in a ray sensor.  Example SDF, using values that are appropriate for a Hokuyo UTM-30LX:

          <noise>
            <type>gaussian</type>
            <mean>0.0</mean>
            <stddev>0.01</stddev>
          </noise>

Basic test included.
summary.html:
Add independent (uncorrelated) Gaussian noise to each beam in a ray sensor. Example SDF, using values that are appropriate for a Hokuyo UTM-30LX:

      <noise>
        <type>gaussian</type>
        <mean>0.0</mean>
        <stddev>0.01</stddev>
      </noise>

Basic test included.

values.description: This is a direct rename. No new code has been added. I'm renaming it to make way for the model editor that will come in a few months. This is also part 1 of the terrain modification pull-request.
values.title: Rename model_editor to building

values.description:
Here is documentation on the tool:

http://gazebosim.org/wiki/Tools#Data_Log_Tool

The primary purpose of this pull-request is to reduce the size of log files through filtering.

values.description: Use SDF 1.3 for parsed urdf files for now, since parser_urdf wasn't upgraded with the SDF 1.4 pull request. This is necessary for DRCSIM.
values.title: Fix URDF parsing with SDF 1.4
